description: The Department of Foreign Affairs Trade and Development Canada (DFATD) has identified a requirement for multiple Application Software Architects and Programmer Analysts with a Secret clearance to provide support to Business Solutions team in the delivery of Digital Transformation projects for departmental projects and initiatives
full_summary:
**Title**: TBIPS – DFATD MS Dynamics 365 and Power Platform Technical Centre of Excellence Services

**Publication Date**: May 29, 2024

**Tender Closing Date**: June 21, 2024, 2:00 PM

**Reference Number**: cb-222-75485364

**Amendment Number**: 1

**Solicitation Number**: 24-262789

**Procurement Category**: Service

**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal against Supply Arrangement (RFP-AS)

**Description**: The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD) is seeking a service provider to establish a Technical Centre of Excellence for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform services. The successful contractor will be responsible for providing technical expertise and support to DFATD's Business Solutions team in the delivery of digital transformation projects.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Provide technical expertise and support to DFATD's Business Solutions team
* Collaborate with project stakeholders to ensure project deliverables meet business requirements
* Develop and implement technical solutions using Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
* Provide ongoing maintenance and support for existing applications

**Eligibility**: Contractors must have a valid Secret security clearance and a proven track record of delivering similar services.

**Trade Agreements**: This tender may be subject to various trade agreements. Please refer to the attached notice for details.

**Regions of Opportunity**: National Capital Region (NCR)

**Contracting Entity**: Global Affairs Canada

**Contact Information**: Betty Woodman, betty.woodman@international.gc.ca, (343) 203-6922

**Attachments**: Refer to the attached notice for additional information and documents.

Note:

* The syntax formatting in the rewritten text is according to the standard Markdown formatting.
* I excluded non-relevant details, and condensed the text to fit within the 400-word limit, but kept all the key points of the original text.
* I rewrote the text in a more professional and clear manner, using standard technical writing best practices. Let me know if you would like me to make any adjustments!  Let me know if you need me to make any changes.
